name: Vision
description: Visioning is a process in which images of the desired future (goals, objectives, outcomes) are made intensely real and compelling to act as motivators for the present action. Imagination is the ability to produce and simulate novel objects, peoples and ideas in the mind without any immediate input of the senses. Thinking strategically is essentially a way of being, a mindset, a way of looking at things and linking them together.

questions.text: I have a plan how to achieve my dreamjob.
I can easily come up with new ideas
I can easily get others excited about my ideas
I can build an inspiring vision (idea)
I can use my vision to guide others to convince.

feedbacks.text:
Your score indicates that your abilities of visioning, imagination and strategic thinking, tends to be low. You may have difficulties to produce and simulate new ideas, dreams or visions. Strategic thinkers have high levels of critical thinking skills. They are also more observant and reflective than the average person. They challenge themselves and others consider answers for particular questions.

Strategic talented thinkers create connections between ideas, plans and people that others fail to see. You could give yourself a change to see those connections by giving yourself time to just to dream and think, without any interruption or devices. Let your mind to see those possibilities. You can develop your imagination skills by doing some activities, for example -My dream profession.

Your score indicates that your abilities of visioning, imagination and strategic thinking, tends to be high. You can easily produce and simulate new ideas, dreams or visions. You have good abilities to create connections between ideas, plans and people that others fail to see. You challenge yourself and others consider answers for particular questions.

Strategic thinkers have high levels of critical thinking skills. They are also more observant and reflective than the average person. You may be one of those.

name: Self awareness and self-efficacy
description: Self-efficacy is one's belief in one's ability to succeed in specific situations or accomplish a task. Self-efficacy in all forms influence one’s thoughts, emotions, actions, and motivation. One's sense of self-efficacy can play a major role in how one approaches goals, tasks, and challenges People with high self-efficacy are more likely to make efforts to complete a task, and to persist longer in those efforts, than those with low self-efficacy. Self-efficacy can be focused upon specific areas such as self-efficacy for sports or self-efficacy for academics. This score is a more assessment of self-efficacy how you recognize your strengths and generally feel about your ability to handle situations successfully.

questions.text: I am aware of my strengthens
I know how to improve my weaknesses
It is easy for me to stick to my aims
It is easy for me to accomplish my goals.
I can recognize real life problems that needs to be solved
When I am stuck with a problem I can find a solution.
If I try hard enough I can always achieve my dreams

feedbacks.text:
Your score indicates that your overall self- efficacy, or how you feel about yourself, tends to be low. This indicates that you may have not recognized your strengths. You may also lack confidence about your ability to successfully handle situations. You may have difficulties with sticking to your aims, or accomplish your goals. You feel difficulties with problem-solving or tend to be pessimistic, fear failure, and tend to avoid trying solutions. A good idea to build and sustain self- efficacy is to set goals reasonably and approach them one by one. Goals can be break down into smaller subgoals and work on achieving them one at a time,slowly and not over-stressing about results.

Remember also do things that you like to do, trying new things and facing challenges. Be gracious to yourself by accepting failures and criticisms positively.

You can stick to your aims and successfully accomplish your goals.

You have a strong sense of problem-solving focused on taking action with high hopes for success. You generally do not fear failure and are optimistic about outcomes. You tend to be calm especially when facing problems.

name: Working with others
description: Working with others is the ability to effectively interact, cooperate, collaborate and manage conflicts with other people in order to complete tasks and achieve shared goals. This includes working with one other person, or working in small or large groups of people, for example co-students, co- workers, managers, employees, clients, and contractors. Effectively working with others in the in the school (or elsewhere) involves understanding and working within the group’s culture, rules and values; joint planning and decision- making; negotiating and compromising; expressing one’s opinions and ideas and respecting those of others, including people of differing backgrounds; and being flexible in terms of roles including knowing when to take a leadership role and knowing when to seek a team approach.

questions.text: I am a good team player (acknowledging others ideas)
I am a good team builder
I can create a specific team to solve specific problems
When I have a problem I know whom to contact
I can manage teams when finding new solutions
I can solve conflicts in teams

feedbacks.text: Your score indicates that your abilities to working with others tends to be low. You may feel that you could be a better team player. A good team player will unify others for a purpose by exchanging information and ideas and empower them and have trust in them. You rarely succeed to solve conflicts with other people in order to complete tasks and achieve shared goals. You may have difficulties to find help from your networks to solve a problem. A good idea to build your team player abilities is to listen actively your team members. That means that you are taking their viewpoint into account. If you are having problems in your team, you can offer a solution for it. Remember to support and respect your team members. A good team player knows how to have fun, but would never do it at someone else’s expense.

Your score indicates that your abilities to working with others tends to be high.

You consider yourself as a good team player who will unify others for a purpose by exchanging information and ideas and empower them and have trust in them.

You succeed to solve conflicts with other people in order to complete tasks and achieve shared goals.

You find easily help from your networks to solve a problem.

You listen actively your team members. That means that you are taking their viewpoint into account.

If you are having problems in your team, you always offer a solution for it. You support and respect your team members.

You always remember, that a good team player knows how to have fun, but would never do it at someone else’s expense.
